roleset.name: arrange so as to be parallel, harmonious with
roleset.note: ALIGN-V NOTES: VN updated by Julia. No Vncls. (from align.01-v)
ALIGNMENT-N NOTES: Expanded by Julia based on BOLT, align.01. No VNcls. (from alignment.01-n)
ALIGNED-J NOTES: Roleset based on instances in BOLT P01, parts 2,3. Framed by Claire; based on verb align.01. No Vncls. (from aligned.01-j)

role.descr: second thing, standard of comparison, aligned-to
subject matter, domain of alignment; issue aligned on

example.name: passive, align with
example.text: ``We expect near-term sluggishness in the electronics market,'' he said, ``and we will take ongoing cost-reduction actions as necessary to keep [operations]-1 aligned *trace*-1 with demand.''

example.name: active, align to. I'll bet he wears a tin foil hat to bed, too.
example.text: John aligned his bed to the earth's magnetic field.

example.name: args 1, 2, 3
example.text: McCain double talks his alignment with Bush on Iraq.

example.name: all things in arg1
example.text: Notice the ice cap weight shifting it is due to earth s own inertia and the sun moon alignment .

example.name: with degree
example.text: ...replace her with Kevin Rudd yet again who-1 *T*-1 is extremely pro-China and less aligned with the United States although he will probably suck up to Obama as well .
example.arg: although he will probably suck up to Obama as well .

example.name: All args, translation
example.text: Not very credible specifically here in it's original form until it was aligned with the Original Hebrew by the Masoretes later on.
